snippet: The federal government has secretly taken information on foreigners overseas for years from companies like Google, Facebook and Apple, the director of national intelligence confirmed.
abstract: James Clapper, director of national intelligence, confirms that federal government has been secretly collecting information on foreigners overseas for nearly six years from nation's largest Internet companies like Google, Facebook and Apple, in search of national security threats; confirmation comes hours after officials acknowledged separate seven-year effort by National Security Agency to sweep up Verizon records of telephone calls inside United States.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE, EDWARD WYATT and PETER BAKER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Eric Schmitt, Jonathan Weisman and James Risen from Washington; Brian X. Chen, Vindu Goel, Claire Cain Miller, Nicole Perlroth, Somini Sengupta and Michael S. Schmidt from San Francisco; and Nick Wingfield from Seattle.
